data.title: Voice actors & how you know them
data.meta_description: The Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast has been revealed, and here is how you might recognise the list of voice actors. Bode, Gabs and many more new characters!
data.text:
The Mantis gang are all back in the form of Cameron Monaghan, Debra Wilson and Daniel Roebuck who are confirmed to reprise their roles as Cal Kestis, Cere Junda and Greez Dritus, respectively.

There are new characters, too, including Gabs and Bode who you will encounter early on in proceedings for the Star Wars game.

There are dozens of actors involved and you're bound to recognise various other games, films, and TV shows, with a fair few sharing their likenesses too.

More like this

Plus, you may also have some surprises from other areas of the Star Wars timeline who appear in various eras from when Jedi: Survivor is set.

Read on below to discover the confirmed full Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast list and where you may recognise the voice actors from.

Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast: Voice actors & how you know them

The confirmed full list of Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast members is below.

The list is split into three sections in the game's closing credits, and we assume this first bunch did full performance capture.

How do you know the Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast?

There are a number of recognisable faces and voices in the Star Wars Jedi: Survivor cast. You may remember them from appearances across film, TV, and other games.

Cameron Monaghan plays Cal Kestis

We’ll start with Cameron Monaghan, who voices and portrays the main player character Cal Kestis. Of course, anyone who has played Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order will recognise the actor from that, but he’s perhaps most well known for his 20 episodes in the Batman prequel series Gotham (Jerome Valeska/Jeremiah Valeska) and from the US version of Shameless, in which he played Ian Gallagher for 127 episodes.

Debra Wilson plays Cere Junda

Debra Wilson, who voices and portrays Cere Junda in the game, is another returnee from the original. You may recognise her from Forspoken, in which she also provides her voice and likeness as Bellette Krau and as the voice of Mayor Stevenson in Need for Speed Unbound. She’s also voiced Amanda Waller in Batman: The Enemy Within and the upcoming Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League.

Daniel Roebuck plays Greez Dritus

Daniel Roebuck, the voice and mocap talent of Greez Dritus, is another returning cast member from Fallen Order. With over 240 IMDb credits to his name, you’re bound to have seen or heard him in something. He's done 10 episodes as Arnold Walker in the TV series The Man in the High Castle, 55 episodes of Matlock, and played Biggs in The Fugitive and its sequel US Marshals.

Tina Ivlev plays Nightsister Merrin

The last of the returning Mantis crew is Tina Ivlev, who plays and voices Nightsister Merrin in Survivor and Fallen Order. She also appeared in the US version of Shameless in which she played Freelania Alexeyevich for three episodes. Other credits for Ivlev include Mayor of Kingstown, MacGyver, and The Young and the Restless.

Cody Fern plays Dagan Gera

Rounding out the cast is Cody Fern, who acts and voices Dagan Gera. You may recognise him from his 21 episodes as Michael Langdon/Xavier Plympton/Valiant Thor in the anthology series American Horror Story. Fern also appeared in House of Cards and The Assassination of Gianni Versace: American Crime Story.

Richard Horvitz plays Torgal

Next is Richard Horvitz who plays Torgal in the game, who is most well known for voicing Zim in Invader Zim, Billy in The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy, and the voice of Alpha 5 in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers.

Noshir Dalal plays Bode Akuna

Noshir Dalal, who voices and plays Bode Akuna, has appeared in the likes of Red Dead Redemption 2 and Star Wars: The Bad Batch (15 episodes).

Tracy Ifeachor plays Santari Khiri

Tracy Ifeachor, the voice and acting talent of Santari Khri here, has appeared in Quantico (11 episodes as Lydia Bates) and DC’s Legends of Tomorrow.

Tommie Earl Jenkins plays Gulu

Tommie Earl Jenkins, who voices Gulu in the game, played Mayor Noble Walker in Netflix’s Wednesday.

DC Douglas plays Rayvis

DC Douglas, the voice and actor of Rayvis, has appeared in a bunch of different animes, including Welcome to Demon-School, Iruma-kun.

Elisabeth Frances plays Mosey Cimarron

Elizabeth Frances, who voices Mosey Cimarron in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, appeared as Prairie Flower in 20 episodes of The Son.

Kendal Rae plays Zee

Last but not least is Kendal Rae, who voices and acts Zee in the game. She’s perhaps most well known in Australia for her 457 episodes of the soap opera The Shak, in which she plays Picasso.

Two fun inclusions in the 'unnamed roles' section are Sam Witwer (who played Starkiller in The Force Unleashed games) and Yuri Lowenthal (who plays Spider-Man in the recent PS4 games). We've no idea who they played, but it's nice to have them involved!
